column4: sorry to keep bothering you guys. for some reason after a few reboots the livecd worked. how do i mount my hd and how do i run fsck just on that mounted hd.
first, you don't run fsck on a mounted drive.  Second,  sudo fsck /dev/<device>
then how do i run fsck without mounting it?
i have three devices sda1 - linux, sda2 "extended" and sda 5 "linux swap". fsck only runs on the first one... which one is my hd?

they are all your hard disk. sda1 is the partition where linux is installed, sda2 is a container for logical partitions, and sda5 is the partition that is used for memory swap. Only the first needs fscking
thanks. well, it came up clean. now i am just confused.
sorry, you scrolled off and I forgot who I wanted to talk to :) What's the error?
what's the complete error? on http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org
so the fsck /dev/sda1 came out clean. fsck /dev/hda returned this: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/55162/
hda is the entire disk, not a partition. it is not fsck'able
so, back to the real issue: You can't boot?
does windows boot?
i dont have windows.
so, you have to have some kind of error.
what do you mean? yes : "Error 16:Inconsistent filesystem"
and when you    sudo fsck /dev/hda1 , what do you get?
put /boot/grub/menu.lst on http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org

wait a second i think it just randomly started working. i ran a recovery mode with the previous kernel and it went through. after i tried to do the very same thing at least 10 times earlier. this system works in mysterious ways
well, everything worked. all of a sudden. with no clear explanation as to what the hell was happening to it for the last few hours. *shrug*
lol, you did something right in your flailing.
well hopefully, it wont happen again. thanks!
